Package Election

Class Election

java.lang.Object
Election.Election
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClosedListElection, MPOMV, OpenListElection

  • Field Details

    • parties

      protected List<Party> parties
      List of parties participating in the election.

    • totalSeats

      protected int totalSeats
      Total number of seats available in the election.

    • totalVotes

      protected int totalVotes
      Total number of votes cast in the election.

  • Constructor Details

    • Election

      public Election(int totalSeats, int totalVotes)
      Constructs an Election with the specified total seats and total votes. This is the base constructor used by all types of election systems.
      Parameters:
      totalSeats - the total number of seats available in the election
      totalVotes - the total number of votes cast in the election

  • Method Details

    • calculateQuota

      public static double calculateQuota(int totalVotes, int totalSeats)
      Calculates the quota needed for a party to win a seat. This static method provides a generic formula to calculate the number of votes needed per seat.
      Parameters:
      totalVotes - the total number of votes cast in the election
      totalSeats - the total number of seats available in the election
      Returns:
      the quota required to win a seat
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the total number of seats is 0

    • addParty

      public void addParty(Party party)
      Adds a party to the list of parties participating in the election. This method allows for dynamic addition of parties before the election is conducted.
      Parameters:
      party - the party to be added

    • conductElection

      public abstract void conductElection(List<String> ballotData)
      Conducts the election based on the given ballot data. This abstract method must be implemented by subclasses to specify the election process.
      Parameters:
      ballotData - a list of strings representing the ballot data

    • calculateSeats

      protected abstract void calculateSeats()
      Calculates the distribution of seats among parties. This abstract method must be implemented by subclasses to specify the seat allocation process.

    • getParties

      public List<Party> getParties()
      Gets the list of parties participating in the election.
      Returns:
      the list of parties

    • findPartyByName

      public Party findPartyByName(String partyName)
      Finds a party by name among the list of parties. This utility method helps locate a party based on its name, ignoring case differences.
      Parameters:
      partyName - the name of the party to find
      Returns:
      the party if found, or null if no party matches the given name

    • getTotalSeats

      public int getTotalSeats()
      Gets the total number of seats available in the election.
      Returns:
      the total number of seats

    • getTotalVotes

      public int getTotalVotes()
      Gets the total number of votes cast in the election.
      Returns:
      the total number of votes

    • updateElection

      public void updateElection(int additionalSeats, int additionalVotes)
      Updates the election with additional seats and votes. This method can be used to dynamically adjust the election parameters.
      Parameters:
      additionalSeats - the number of additional seats available from new data
      additionalVotes - the number of additional votes cast from new data

    • setElectionType

      public void setElectionType(String type)
      Sets the type of the election.

      This method allows changing the type of the election. The type can be any string that the system recognizes as a valid election type.

      Parameters:
      type - The new type of the election as a String.

    • getElectionType

      public String getElectionType()
      Retrieves the type of the election.

      This method returns the current type of the election. The returned type is a string that has been set previously by the setElectionType(String) method.

      Returns:
      The current type of the election as a String.
